attributes.action: introduce legislation (THAT'S THE ACTION WE WANT HIM TO TAKE) to change the rules so that anybody turning up, or being delivered, to a NHS facility in a drunken condition can be turned away if they cannot pay, upfront, for the taxpayer funded treatment they might be expecting.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Everything else has been tried.  One sure fired way of solving the binge drinking problem is to make anybody who is drunk liable for the cost of any treatment they receive from any NHS facility BEFORE they receive it.  The taxpayer should NOT be made responsible for the consequences of anybody's lack of self control when it comes to alcohol consumption.  There are too many genuinely medically ill people in this country who are being denied taxpayer funded medical treatment because we can't afford it without us also having to pay for the medical treatment necessary after somebody gets themselves drunk on alcohol.
